intro: Crepinia dalmatica, commonly known as Dalmatian crepe jasmine, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for gardens in temperate climates. Crepinia dalmatica is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
